entries.author: miguel_prz
entries.text: Miguel Prz (NICEPERL)'s regular lists: Great modules released last week; MetaCPAN weekly report; StackOverflow Perl report.
entries.title: NICEPERL's lists

entries.text: Miroslav has written some CPAN tutorials, and they're on github so you can contribute and/or give feedback.
entries.title: CPAN Tutorials

entries.author: max_maischein
entries.text: Another entry in Max's occasional series about tidying up code he's written, to release as hopefully-useful CPAN modules. His new module File::MimeInfo will try to identify the MIME type of a file.
entries.title: Introducing MIME::Detect

entries.author: eugen_konkov
entries.title: Short presentation of The new Perl debugger

entries.author: frew_schmidt
entries.text: Frew has released Digest::MurmurHash2::Neutral, an implementation of MurmurHash 2, to join the existing MurmurHash, and MurmurHash3.
entries.title: Announcing Digest::MurmurHash2::Neutral

entries.author: mark_keating
entries.text: The first-ever P5P hackathon is going to be held in Amsterdam, from 11th to 14th November this year, hosted by Booking.com and officially supported by The Perl Foundation.
entries.title: The 2016 P5P Hackathon

entries.author: david_farrell
entries.text: David shares 5 things he learned from reading the 7th edition of Learning Perl, which will be released later this month.
entries.title: 5 things I learned from Learning Perl 7th Edition

entries.text: A round-up of the goings-on from the Perl 6 world, including the first fully-automated released of the Rakudo Perl 6 compiler.
entries.title: We Are The Robots

entries.author: ruth_bavousett
entries.text: Ruth chats with Jeff Goff about Perl 6, in an article aimed at people outside the Perl echo chamber.
entries.title: The must-have features for Perl 6

entries.author: yanick_champoux
entries.text: Yanick has been looking at Javascript frameworks (a never-ending job!), then thinking about what they might look like in Perl. In this post, and a followup, he introduces Perl ideas based on MobX, a framework that claims it "makes state management simple and scalable by transparently applying functional reactive programming".
entries.title: MoobX: MobX + Moose

entries.author: mark_keating
entries.text: The Perl Foundation (TPF) is going to have a stand at OSCON Europe, which is on London, 17th - 18th October. If you're going, drop by and said hello.
entries.title: TPF at OSCON London

entries.author: karen_pauley
entries.text: Tony Cook has requested another $20k, to continue his work on Perl 5. If you have an opinion on this, add it to the comments on this post.
entries.title: Grant Extension Request for Tony Cook

entries.text: An update on the TPF grant for RPerl documentation.
entries.title: RPerl User Documentation #2

entries.author: karen_pauley
entries.text: Jonathan's grant extension has been approved.
entries.title: Jonathan Worthington's Grant Extension Accepted

entries.text: Barcelona Perl Mongers are having a one-day Perl workshop on Saturday 5th November. Hey, why not submit a talk!
entries.title: Barcelona Perl Workshop

entries.text: A summary of proceedings at Day 1 on the Dancer conference.
entries.title: Day 1 at DancerCon

entries.text: A dissection of the MIT open-source licence. If you release open-source, you need to know at least something about open-source licences, as any code you release should always specify the licence under which it is released.
entries.title: The MIT License, Line by Line

entries.author: gabor_szabo
entries.text: Part of the Perl Dancer series.
entries.title: Convert list to table and add jQuery tablesorting with Date column

entries.author: gabor_szabo
entries.text: Part of the test automation with Perl series. (screencast)
entries.title: Creating a testing module

entries.author: mohammad_anwar
entries.title: Mohammad S. Anwar - Contributing to CPAN every single day

header: ... you don't get one for ages, and then two come along together! Last week we heard about meta::hack (the MetaCPAN hackathon), and this week we heard about the P5P hackathon in November.
And the Barcelona Perl Workshop is on Saturday 5th November.
subject: Hackathons are like buses ...
